info.title: Pricing API
info.description:
This API hub sets the foundations for the following Pricing APIs:
- Order API, used to manage orders in Epilot 360:
  - Pricing features such as automatic calculation of totals and price breakdowns for taxes
  - Product and pricing data validation
- Shopping Cart API, used to interact with a cart during a customer's checkout session, and it's responsible for providing the following set of features:
  - A unified data model to model a Shopping Cart
  - Cart abandonment recovery
  - Product and pricing data validation
  - Checkout a cart into an order, invoice, or quote

- Product Catalog API, provides a way to query the entire catalog of products and prices.
  - Exposes querying operations to access the customer Product Catalog

- Product Availability Service, provides a way to check for products availability by a set of predefined dimensions.

tags.name: Cart
tags.description: The shopping cart & checkout management operations

post.description:
Checkouts a cart and executes the specified checkout `mode` process.

A Checkout implicitly finalizes the provided cart (if not transient from a fast-checkout) and behaves in one of the following modes:
- `create_order` (**default**): the payment happens at a later date or managed by 3rd-party CRM (SAP)
- `create_invoice`: the payment happens on the online checkout (paypal, stripe, adyen)
- `create_quote`: the checkout represents a price quote request

Fast checkout is also supported, by passing the Cart contents directly.
When a fast checkout is performed the cart is considered transient and there is no cart persistance.

If the checkout `mode` is omitted, the `mode` will default to `create_order`.
